intro: Monnina richardiana var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant has slender, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to full sun exposure. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
